Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 209B.proposition: The Plaintiff asserts that this Court has jurisdiction over this matter pursuant to Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 209B, Section 2.

Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 209,.proposition: Venue is proper in Middlesex Probate and Family Court under Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 209, Section 5.

See *Smith v. Jones*, 123 Mass. 456 (201.proposition: Massachusetts caselaw recognizes that a custodial parent's unexplained failure to ensure a child's regular school attendance constitutes a substantial change in circumstances justifying a modification of custody.

Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 208,.proposition: Furthermore, Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 208, Section 28, authorizes the Court to modify a custody order if it is in the best interests of the child.
